channel.title: Code for ToS page like here?
channel.description: Does anyone have the code for the ToS page like moparisthebest? To type 'yes' and click the button after? I'm bad at php things, well bad at web design

item.title: Code for ToS page like here?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/agreement.phps

It’s been there for awhile, and yes you check for the cookie on the index page and redirect to the agreement if it isn’t set.

Lock my thread please

[quote=“chr1s1992, post:6, topic:150915”]Wouldent you need to put make a cookie in agreement.php… cause im looking to do the same thing buts its very hard… i put

<?php if (!isset($_COOKIE["free_cookie"]) || $_COOKIE["free_cookie"] != "yes" ){ header("Location: http://site.org/agreement.php?returnto=http://comeback.net"); } in the forum index and that other html code in agreement.[/quote] Don't want my thread bumped by a ban evader and scammer. ty for the note Ikiliki.

item.title: Code for ToS page like here?
item.dc:creator: @chr1s1992 chr1s1992
item.description:
@chr1s1992 wrote:

Wouldent you need to put make a cookie in agreement.php… cause im looking to do the same thing buts its very hard… i put

<?php if (!isset($_COOKIE["free_cookie"]) || $_COOKIE["free_cookie"] != "yes" ){ header("Location: http://site.org/agreement.php?returnto=http://comeback.net"); } in the forum index and that other html code in agreement.

Read full topic
item.source: Code for ToS page like here?

item.title: Code for ToS page like here?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“Exception, post:4, topic:150915”]Simple php redirection…

<?php if(isset($_GET['returnto'])) { header("Location: " . $_GET['returnto']); } ?>

To check if you have accepted the agreement or not…

<?php if(!isset($_COOKIE['YOUR_COOKIE_NAME'])) { header("Location: agreement.php"); } ?>

Something like that…[/quote]i guess you would have to put that on top of every html or php page you have.

or you can try this:

<?php if (!isset($_COOKIE["free_cookie"]) || $_COOKIE["free_cookie"] != "yes" ){ header("Location: http://site.org/agreement.php?returnto=http://comeback.net"); }

comeback.net = if they dont have free_cookie then it redirects to the agreement page. then it goes back to where they clicked on…

– confusing but try to understand it

Read full topic

item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Simple php redirection…

<?php if(isset($_GET['returnto'])) { header("Location: " . $_GET['returnto']); } ?>

To check if you have accepted the agreement or not…

<?php if(!isset($_COOKIE['YOUR_COOKIE_NAME'])) { header("Location: agreement.php"); } ?>

Something like that…

item.title: Code for ToS page like here?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[code]

Terms Of Agreements body{ font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt; background-color: #000000; } div{background: #E5E5E8; width: 70%; border: 1px solid black; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;} input{border: 1px solid black;} body,td,th { color: #000066; }
By typing 'yes' you agree to everything stated below:

You are not an employee of Jagex LTD, runescape, or adlex solicitors, and are not a family member or acquaintance of the aforementioned.

All of the information on this site is solely for learning purposes, as the main purpose of this site is to instruct people in the art of programming. All programs provided for download from this site are entirely coded by the members of this community and are not the intellectual property of any business or organization.


As a member of the forum you accept that you will not:

- Double post, this means post two posts one after another, if you must, edit your post use the edit button.
- Post harmful links, do not post any links containing porn, death, or harmful files.
- Flame, do not flame anyone everyone here deserves respect.
- Spam, useless posts will not be tolerated.
- Sexually Harass, both man and women are equal.
- Impersonate, there shall be no impersonation of Jagex staff, Project Unknown staff, Runescape members or anybody else.
- Upload Viruses, failing to comply and we will alert the proper authorities.
- Plagiarize, taking someone elses work and claiming it as your own if forbidden.
- Advertise, any harmful content is banned, appropriate content is allowed only in signatures unless otherwise stated in the forum.
Regarding Signatures and Avatars
One signature per person is allowed it should not excide 400*150 and should be kept under 45kb. Avatars max size is 80*80 and should not exceed 10kb. Failing to comply after warning will result in your privileges being taken away
Punishments
We go on a 5 strike warning.
1st Strike is a warning.
2nd Warned (3 Days)
3rd Moderated (7 Days)
4th Muted (7 Days)
5th Banned (7 Days)
6th Ip Banned (Forever)

If after 6 strikes you still are breaking rules its a permanent ban.
Staff Compliance
1) Staff has the right at any time to warn you if they feel you have broken one or more of the Project Unknown's
Terms of Server (TOS).

2) Staff members have the right to warn you, place you on Moderators Que, Remove Your Posting Rights, or Suspend you for breaking any one of our TOS without warning and without following the Warning System if the rule you have broken could have inflicted harm on any race, gender, or specific person.

3) We take punishment of our staff very seriously. If a staff member misbehaves, he/she will be immediatly kept an eye on.
Our Obligations
Project Unknown provides our members with several different services, including message boards, Project Unkown Server, and Affilations. Our services to you are the above, and you understand that as a user of our services, we may have to rotate advertisements to continue to carry out our services. You also understand that for the sake of promoting our site, some advertisements may be for our site. Project Unknown is in no way obligated by law, authority, or any other hierarchy to provide our services to you. Nothing is promised. We are here to play and help you to better enjoy your Project Unknown Server experience. Any special ranks are not promised to be fully carried out, and we are NOT obligated to do so. Project Unknown is also not obligated to host any files from any member, and has the right to refuse a file, a member, or a group at our discretion
Acceptance
The services provided to you through this message board and website are provided by Project Unknown and its management. We have the right to update these Board Guidelines and Terms of Service (TOS) at our discretion without public or personal notification. It is your duty as a member of Project Unknown to frequently check for updates to these TOS. A up to date version may always be found here at this link


Type 'yes' if you agree to ALL of the above terms.
You must have cookies enabled for this to work.

[/code]

change the link

Read full topic
